diseases.description: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, primarily affecting the nose and throat. It is caused by various viruses, most commonly rhinoviruses. Colds are highly contagious and can spread easily through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes.
treatment: Warm saltwater gargle for sore throat
Humidifier use to relieve nasal congestion

locations: Any location with access to basic healthcare facilities

preventionTips: Wash hands frequently with soap and water
Avoid close contact with infected individuals
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or elbow when coughing or sneezing
Avoid touching your face with unwashed hands
Stay home when you are sick
diseases.recoveryTime: Usually 7 to 10 days, depending on the individual's immune system and overall health.
diseases.costEstimate: Varies, typically low for over-the-counter medications, usually less than $20.
